title: Passenger shamed over shocking mile-high act
text:
What are these? A woman allegedly caused quite a stir during a recent flight. Picture: CEN/australscope Source: Facebook 
IF YOU’RE still not convinced that the mere act of stepping on a plane can change peoples’ behaviour to the point of outrageousness, then this ought to do the trick. 
A passenger has been shamed online for allegedly letting her son urinate in an airsickness bag in his seat, instead of using the lavatory. 
The urine splashed over Vietnam Airlines’ brand new plane, one unhappy fellow passenger claims in a Facebook post that has gone viral. 
The post read: “On board this beautiful A350 which still has that new plane smell (currently at 9000m, so you can still use the lavatory), one beautiful female passenger in Seat 11B, with 10 fingernails painted in 10 colours, dressed very fashionably, tore open a vomit bag for her son to pee in, splashing everywhere. 
“Chief Steward asked why not go into the lavatory. Dirtying the plane, but the passenger didn’t even want to look/acknowledge the Chief Steward. Truly insane.” That’s not what you’re mean to use an airsickness bag for ... Picture: CEN/australscope Source: Facebook 
It’s claimed the woman is a popular Vietnamese singer, though this has not been confirmed. 
The new Airbus plane has only just started flying between Hanoi and Saigon. 
news.com.au has contacted Vietnam Airlines for comment. Airline fails 3:12
